name: Select

types.name: Config
types.comment: Opaque type that holds the configuration

types.name: Msg
types.comment: Opaque type for internal library messages

types.name: State
types.comment: Opaque type that holds the current state

values.name: newConfig
values.comment:
Create a new configuration. This takes:

- A message to trigger when an item is selected
- A function to get a label to display from an item


    Select.newConfig OnSelect .label
values.type: (Maybe.Maybe item -> msg) -> (item -> String) -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: newState
update
values.comment:
Update the component state

    SelectMsg subMsg ->
        let
            ( updated, cmd ) =
                Select.update selectConfig subMsg model.selectState
        in
            ( { model | selectState = updated }, cmd )
values.type: Select.Config msg item -> Select.Msg item -> Select.State -> ( Select.State, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )

values.name: view
values.comment:
Render the view

    Html.map SelectMsg (Select.view selectConfig model.selectState model.items selectedItem)
values.type: Select.Config msg item -> Select.State -> List item -> Maybe.Maybe item -> Html.Html (Select.Msg item)

values.name: withClearClass
values.comment:
Add classes to the clear button

    Select.withClearClass "clear" config
values.type: String -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: withClearStyles
values.comment:
Add styles to the clear button

    Select.withClearStyles [("width", "2rem")] config
values.type: List ( String, String ) -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: withClearSvgClass
values.comment:
Add classes to the clear SVG icon

    Select.withClearSvgClass "clear" config
values.type: String -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: withCutoff
values.comment:
Set the maxium number of items to show

    Select.withCutoff 6 config
values.type: Int -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: withInputClass
values.comment:
Add classes to the input

    Select.withInputClass "col-12" config
values.type: String -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: withInputStyles
values.comment:
Add styles to the input

    Select.withInputStyles [("color", "red")] config
values.type: List ( String, String ) -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: withInputWrapperClass
values.comment:
Add classes to the input wrapper (element that wraps the input and the clear button)

    Select.withInputWrapperClass "col-12" config
values.type: String -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: withInputWrapperStyles
values.comment:
Add styles to the input wrapper

    Select.withInputWrapperStyles [("color", "red")] config
values.type: List ( String, String ) -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: withItemClass
values.comment:
Add classes to the items

    Select.withItemClass "border-bottom" config
values.type: String -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: withItemStyles
values.comment:
Add styles to the items

    Select.withItemStyles [("color", "peru")] config
values.type: List ( String, String ) -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: withMenuClass
values.comment:
Add classes to the menu

    Select.withMenuClass "bg-white" config
values.type: String -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: withMenuStyles
values.comment:
Add styles to the menu

    Select.withMenuStyles [("padding", "1rem")] config
values.type: List ( String, String ) -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item

values.name: withOnQuery
values.comment:
Add a callback for when the query changes

    Select.withOnQuery OnQuery
values.type: (String -> msg) -> Select.Config msg item -> Select.Config msg item
